instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S0: What is PP5V_S0? PP5V_S0 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S0 working state..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.S5_PWRGD: What is S5_PWRGD? The S5_PWRGD signal is a status signal that indicates the S5 rails are on and functioning properly. If this is not present, check the S5 rails to see if they are functioning, and the chip that creates S5_PWRGD..
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.ADAPTER_EN: What is ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_MANUAL_RST_L: What is SMC_MANUAL_RST_L? SMC_MANUAL_RST_L resets the SMC when low.   _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesnt turn ON
threads.message:
Hi there,

Was water damage but not too bad. After ultrasonic clean:

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3HOT</SIGNAL> -12.5V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.5V 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S0</SIGNAL> - 0.3V
<SIGNAL>S5_PWRGD</SIGNAL> -3.4V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> - 0V
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> - 0V

Corrosion was on:
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP>
<CAPACITOR>C5120</CAPACITOR>
<CAPACITOR>C5127</CAPACITOR>
<RESISTOR>R5127</RESISTOR>

Please advice how to proceed. Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesnt turn ON
threads.message: <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> should be high of course. Using a 60 or 85W charger? <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> high? Green/orange light present?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesnt turn ON
threads.message:
No light on Magsafe. No <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, no <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL>.
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> pin 1 - 3.42V.
Using good old apple magsafe 1 85W with dual output: 18.5V 4.6A and 16.5V 3.6A but also tried with 60W Magsafe just in case ;)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesnt turn ON
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> high? <SIGNAL>SMC_MANUAL_RST_L</SIGNAL> high? <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> within specification?

If yes to all, I'd say replace <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesnt turn ON
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> is not high then PPBUS can never be 12.5V, it will be 12.3V. Also you have no green light so why did you even measure anything after that?
<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> issue, <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> corroded or crap under SMC.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesnt turn ON
threads.message:
Correct. PPBUS is 12.3V.
Replaced <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>. One leg was corroded.
Got orange light on MAgsafe but still no <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> or <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>.
Put contact cleaner under SMC. Then ultrasonic it. Then pressure air. Dry. Test. No Luck. Reflow with flux. No luck. No more orange on Magsafe.
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> high
<SIGNAL>SMC_MANUAL_RST_L</SIGNAL> low
<RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> replaced because was off but now in right value.
SMC?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesnt turn ON
threads.message: Pull SMC and see if <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> comes high.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesnt turn ON
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Doesnt turn ON
threads.message: <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> or pull up resistor then. There is not much more to this circuit. Check voltages on <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>
